title: Stevens: If sports had taken a different route
text:
Stevens: If sports had taken a different route Kevin Stevens, kstevens@pressconnects.com @PSBKevin 4:54 p.m. EDT October 9, 2015 Had decisions and outcomes been different ... Who knows? Remember Roy McAvoy's chase for the Open title? (Photo: Associated Press photo) 1 CONNECT 6 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Plan A twirled down the pipe. 
Screen is as blank as a Kardashian gal’s brain. 
And so, a guy gets to wondering … What if? 
As in, What If … 
The Trail Blazers had gone for Jordan over Bowie with the second pick in the ’84 draft? 
Buckner had scooped Mookie’s grounder in ’86? 
Kentucky opted to obstruct the inbounder that day in ’92 at The Spectrum? 
Verne Lundquist’s iconic call on the 17th at Augusta went, instead, “Maybe … No Sir!” 
The United States lost to Finland in the 1980 gold-medal game at Lake Placid? That was, of course, the “game after.” 
Barry Bonds had decided that natural ability was sufficient? 
Barry Sanders played into his mid-30s? 
Belichick didn’t resign a day into his tenure as coach of the New York Jets in 1999? 
Brooklyn Dodgers manager Chuck Dressen had summoned a reliever for Ralph Branca to pitch to Bobby Thomson? 
Fifty-nine-year-old Tom Watson’s eight-footer for par dropped on the 18th that day at Turnberry? 
Alydar pulled out just one of the three in the spring of ’78? 
Havlicek didn’t steal the ball? Or, the Giants didn’t win the pennant? 
Charlie Hough, Elias Sosa or Burt Hooton opted to pitch around Reggie Jackson that night at Yankee Stadium in ’77? 
Tiger was faithful to Elin? 
Tyson paid an ounce of attention to training leading to that February 1990 fight in the Tokyo Dome? Instead, 42-to-1 underdog Buster Douglas made some savvy investors extremely happy. 
Roy “Tin Cup” McAvoy laid up at the 72nd? 
Someone wearing the uniform of top-ranked Houston had found fit to box out Lorenzo Charles in the waning seconds that 1983 night in Albuquerque? 
Twelve-year-old Jeffrey Maier had a pile of homework and was unable to attend Game 1 of the 1996 ALCS? 
The 1972 Olympic basketball final wasn’t rigged in the Soviets’ favor? 
Major League Baseball owners went the other way in January 1973 and carved up the notion of a designated hitter? 
Nancy Kerrigan had hired a bodyguard? 
Pete Rose restricted his investing to the stock market? 
The Chargers did their due diligence leading to the ’98 draft and figured, nah, this Ryan Leaf fella doesn’t seem a real good fit? 
The Packers grabbed Barry Sanders rather than Tony Mandarich with the No. 2 pick in the ’89 draft? 
Couples’ 8-iron offering trickled into Rae’s Creek instead of defying gravity and hanging on the bank that day in ’92 at Augusta? As he shared years later, “A lot of things were flashing through my mind on the 12th tee. That's the most nervous I have ever been, and that was the biggest break of my life.” 
Chris Webber had a clue and didn’t call timeout in the waning seconds against Carolina that night in ’93? 
The Lions came to the conclusion much sooner that Matt Millen had no Earthly idea what the hell he was doing? 
The Falcons didn’t trade Favre in ’91? 
The Red Sox kinda figured, no, we hadn’t ought to sell Babe to the Yankees after all? 
Plan A went according to form and you’d have been spared the splash of revisionist history?
